intro: Psychotria unioensis, commonly known as the "Cocaine plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. It contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which are chemically complex and have significant pharmacological properties. Due to its psychoactive compounds, it is both ecologically and economically important in certain regions.
